revised_title: Ion Composition and Geomagnetic Control in the Topside Ionosphere
tldr: The authors analyzed data from the satellite Ariel I to study the composition and behavior of the topside ionosphere. They found that the ion composition is strongly controlled by geomagnetic latitude and showed a significant departure from hydrostatic equilibrium. The study also confirmed earlier findings of diurnal and seasonal variations in the ion composition.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ionosphere and Space Weather
